Submodules¶

DataAnalyzer.PlotConfig.plt_Base module¶

The Base module is the parent class of all PlotTypes that are specified in PlotTypes module.

class DataAnalyzer.PlotConfig.plt_Base.Base(plots, title=' ', x_label='time', y_label='Y-Axis', legend='upper left', grid=True, plot_type='LinLin', regression='')[source]¶

Bases: object

This class defines the init method, the most basic configuration can be stored here. For basic 2-dimensional plots, the Plot method is specified in TwoD.plot_TwoD.TwoD.Plot(). For further specification, Plot() calls (if it exists) the plot_specific method, which can be defined in every Plot type.

The basic subplot config gets stored here.

Parameters:
  • plots (list) – Name of the plots that are in the subplot
  • title (str) – subplot title
  • x_label (str) – x_label
  • y_label (str) – y_label
  • legend (str) – legend location (upper left, lower right, …)
  • grid (bool) – toggle grid
  • plot_type (str) – name of class Plot() should be inherited from (it is sufficient to write the name without plt_)
  • regression (str) – optionally add regression type
